content:
@WG-prioritization/alerts issue #86163 has been requested for prioritization.

Procedure

  • Priority?
  • Regression?
  • Notify people/groups?
  • Needs I-nominated?
I think specific tier 2 target is sparcv9-sun-solaris (on x86 is fine, according to the original bug report).
It's an unsoundness bug so I tend to a P-high, but I will wait a bit assigning a priority, I don't have the context on the reproducibility

I agree with P-high, but I think it's best to nominate.

Side note: I may have a conflict of interest as I work on an Apple Silicon machine, which is also Tier 2.
given that comment and the issue confuses the real world usecase (Firefox), +1 for P-high
I really don't like unsoundness hitting real applications like this, even on a tier 2.
Whenever there's a language soundness issue, it's so hard for anyone to even trace the problem to us.
There is precedent for assigning P-critical for soundness issues hitting tier 2 targets. I think I might be inclined to do that here?

A P-critical would mean that in 6 weeks the bug should be fixed (or eventually demoted to P-high as non-blocking for the next 1.54 release).
I've added this to the nominated issue in today's agenda, hopefully the team will have time to share some thoughts
Assigning P-high, hopefully nagisa can have a look at that. today I've learned we don't have a clear referent for SPARC
